headline: Positive tech culture
pros:
- Company is growing so there are opportunities that might not immediately exist
- Company provides regular communication, listen to and consider new ideas, and continually encourages growth, both personally and professionally
willing to share (you typically don't get such easy access and support)
- Our clients are real-time users and we are doing incredible things that impact them directly. That's powerful! (and fun to be associated with)
- This is a place you can call home; many employees have been here a long time which allows deep integration into the business and the ability to create pathways to success for others
cons:
No company is perfect. While we grow, there are things that are evolving (updating
technology, formalizing procedures, etc.) that come along with any
growing company. It's important to not get hung up on what's wrong, but to focus on
what is happening that is right and the progress in actions (not just words) that support
that. With this growth is an opportunity to define the future and the role you play in it.
That mindset is rewarded at People interactive.

headline: Lack of good leadership in tech and no focus on improving technically

The scale at which they operate is great

cons:
Technically they still operate largely on the legacy code and hacky approaches are still preferred to make it work. Hence no chance to learn after a point.

Compensation & hikes are below average

Focus is only on the product side, whereas technical innovation is not encouraged

A lot of credible employees have left the organisation including the CTO and the old employees make sure to work in a way to safeguard their position using internal knowledge

headline: Great place to work for client servicing
pros: Good environment,good office,good people,good canteen..chilled out work Atmosphere and culture..but lot of work pressure..2days off depending on your process..great boss..free breakfast every monday..good infrastructure..owner is very genial too...good seniors,bosses and manager.
cons: No drop facility for women post 9pm.. 2 rotational weekday offs...work pressure is high as u get old...trainer is a very weird personality ...makes you feel a bit demotivated..rest everything is great...but incentives are a bit  tough to earn here...not so easy to earn as they make it sound..but still there are people who do make money  so beware..dont depend on incentives .. rather ask for a decent salary.. understand the system before getting in.

headline: Overall quite satisfied with the company and policies
pros: Give importance to both  Internal and External customer and value their opinion,

headline: Politics, partiality and pathetic management!
pros: 1. You do meet few genuine people.
cons:
1. The entire leadership is partial and you will only get promoted if you are close to your manager on a personal front and share all your personal life drama and baggage. (Become the victim)
2. The management has too much expectations from the advisor level.
3. The policy changes according to the likes of the management and never benefits the junior levels.
4. The higher management who had worked hard to set-up the company have already left.
5. You will be allowed to chill out and not work if you take smoke breaks with the managers.
6. Too much pressure on both the sales and service teams.
7. More than half of their success stories are fake, which were created by the advisors themselves.
8. Too many negative people in the organisation.
9. Knowledge wise no upgrades done, all the training are repetitive and are outdated.
10. Growth is very restricted and many people are working on the advisor level for ages.

headline: Bad culture  - Marketing , design, product and Testing heads left out of frustration
pros:
Top to down everyone is searching for a job. You will see everyone has opened a job search site on there workstation.

All old employees who helped build the company have left. Only the CEO's close people are left in the organization.

Freshers are unhappy as they do not have anyone to guide them. They get scolded for the incompetency of there seniors. Seniors do not have any knowledge as they have been promoted to positions they  cant handle and dont deserve. Product team is very weak. Employees dont come to office but are still awarded in annual functions as the management doesnt have a visibility of the work till the last level. The mid level managers take  away ideas and deliver them as there own. They are rude to everyone below them and use CEOs name for getting work done
cons: The best is over for this company

pros: The office stinks with dampness and leakage smell

headline: Wonderful place to work
pros:
It's a wonderful place to work at. The company has a very open culture. People are very friendly and very approachable. You can walk into the CEO's office anytime and have a very open discussion about what's right and what's not. I have never seen a company which is so receptive to employees' opinions and thoughts. People are valued and respected which comes from the top and goes all the way down to other employees.
Gourav is one of the best leaders you will work with. He is always there to help anyone and is super sharp at work. It was a great learning curve for me working at People Interactive.
cons: Can't think of any.

headline: Poor Company to work with
pros: Nothing as it is a rosy picture at the start and made to fill in glass door review at the induction hence the ratings are very good
cons:
If you are in services domain you live for the customer die for the customer. No festivals nothing process requirement makes you work for all festive days. Process management is so worst that even if you are not well you are made to prove that before you are granted a leave. Even if some one is on death bed you will be asked for proofs before taking leaves. Any leave you take cannot be a CL or SL it has to be Weekoff and you are made to work weekend.
Premium product is not at all worth the money paid hence their is wrong expectations set at start and hence members will run behind you abuse you but customer is the king and respect the king and dump your self respect in a bin

headline: Bad culture promoted by management
pros: Nothing good about the company except for free breakfast on Monday.
cons:
CEO has his favorite managers.  Managers have there favorite reportees. They never attend office and don't work but are paid in full.

The HR says that this is going on since the time these people joined (3 years) . Everyone in the office is aware of them and employees are angry with the management for promoting this behavior. 

For the little time that these people attend office they are found in the smoking area chatting about there parallel business,  sports activities, interview experiences while away from office.  They gloat about there closeness with the CEO. They have told many people that no one in the company can remove them not even the founder as the CEO needs them. 

They are known to shift the blame of non delivery on their teammates, hence every team member they have ever worked with has been asked to leave the organization. 

All teams are complaining about these people : the work is stuck or delayed.

headline: It will change your outlook towards good companies
pros: People are crazy about working with MNC considering the perks and benefits they offer but I personally think anyone who has worked with MNC earlier should atleast once work with Shaadi. It will change your definition of good company. Though it's not located in great premises but the culture inside is very encouraging.  You will be challenged to go beyond your potential everyday and that is the biggest learning you will have. Good / bad suggestions are both debated and discussed in detail. They have a tax friendly salary structure, benefits are decent, 5 day working and much more. While some reviews do mention that there was no increment for 1 year, true, but it was for larger good. Better have job for people rather than layoff. And this year it is well compensated atleast for those who deserved. Go for it, if you get a chance.
cons:
Not a great office, they have multiple offices in one premises
Balance work amongst people, the ones who are delivering are given more

headline: From best, became the worst
pros:
I am sure, most of the glossy reviews written so far about this company has been done by the people who work from the HO at Tardeo, Mumbai. They are the fat managers who dictate from that HO and turn a deaf ear to the employees who work at the hubs and centers. 

Two years from now, the company had many pros. Alas, all of that is gone now. Everyone now seems to be running away from the company; what else can the employees do when they are treated on the whims of the managers.
cons:
The company keeps shifting the employees from one place to another without any prior notice. This causes commutation problem for the employees. 
No respect for creativity.
Never listens to employees who work at the shop level.
Makes people work like machines.
Trainers need serious training.
What the auditors can't understand, they criticize. 
Some supervisor and managers are full of ego. Even if they are wrong, they will try to prove you wrong. They will even fire you to satisfy their ego.
The management is very impulsive and are never true to their promises.

The challenges are daily and varied and leave me satisfied. 
I have grown a lot working here and see a lot of potential for more in the future.

headline: Good Company
pros:
will get to work on large scale website , coding standard is high and with the help of code review you get to know more . So you start thinking all perspective points. 
Nice Employee Friendly Rules and Regulations . Flexible Timings and Nice HR Management. 
If you do want all this things its a best place to work.
cons:
Newer technologies are adopted only when there is bandwidth to explore & implement. 
Seniors like  TL , PL and up level are very arrogant not encourage, not Motivational Kind of people. 
Especially in Technology Team . Don't know about other departments. 
So better don't work here if the people are remain same.
